lead_paragraph: CLARK--Robert Henry Jr.,Case, Pomeroy & Company mourns the loss of Robert "Bob" Henry Clark, Jr., who served the Company for 45 years with exceptional skill and dedication. Mr. Clark died peacefully on March 30, 2016 at his home in Naples, FL after a prolonged battle with cancer. He was 75 years old. After starting his career at Merrill Lynch, Mr. Clark joined Case, Pomeroy & Co. in New York City in 1971. The investment firm was co-founded in 1916 by his wife, Rosalie Case's grandfather, Walter S. Case and later led by her father, Hadley Case. Over various periods of Mr. Clark's distinguished tenure with the Company, he held the offices of President, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman. He also served as a director of Homestake Mining Company from 1984 until 2001, in addition to other private and public companies, and served as a Trustee of Boston University, his Alma Mater, from 1984 until 1987. We extend our deepest condolences to his wife of 52 years, Rosalie Case, his son, Robert H. Clark III and his wife, Jennifer L. Nolen of Roanoke, VA, his daughter, Hilary E. Clark of New York, NY, his son, Hadley C. Clark and his wife, Sara B. Stonner of Larchmont, NY, and four grandchildren. He is also survived by his sister, Sarah Clark Paquette of Minneola, FL. In lieu of flowers, the family has asked that donations may be made to the Castle Preservation Society, P.O. Box 687, Moultonborough, NH 03254. 1/3
